qas.question: How many municipal parks and gardens does Paris have?
When was the Tuileries Garden created?
Who redid the Tuileries Garden in 1664?
Who was the Luxembourg palace built for?
Who created the Jarden des Plantes?

context: Paris today has more than <a0_0>421<a0_0/> municipal parks and gardens, covering more than 3,000 hectares and containing more than 250,000 trees. Two of Paris' oldest and most famous gardens are the Tuileries Garden, created in <a1_0>1564<a1_0/> for the Tuileries Palace, and redone by <a2_0>André Le Nôtre<a2_0/> between 1664 and 1672, and the Luxembourg Garden, for the Luxembourg Palace, built for <a3_0>Marie de' Medici<a3_0/> in 1612, which today houses the French Senate. The Jardin des Plantes was the first botanical garden in Paris, created in 1626 by Louis XIII's doctor <a4_0>Guy de La Brosse<a4_0/> for the cultivation of medicinal plants.
